summary: This is an email from July 6, 2020, providing a status update on the processing of digital evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties, including servers and DVRs from his island and New York apartment. It details the progress of forensic examination and data recovery efforts.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: Recipient of the email providing status update on digital evidence processing in the Epstein case.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Author of the email detailing the status of digital evidence processing from Epstein's properties, including data carving on DVRs.

events.title: Digital Evidence Processing Status Update
events.description: Forensic examiner provides update on processing 55 items of digital evidence from Epstein's properties, including servers from the island and DVRs from NY apartment and island.
personsInvolved: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: 55 items of digital evidence were accounted for in the Epstein investigation as of July 2020.
2 servers from Epstein's island were still being processed due to mechanical difficulties.
3 DVRs (1 from NY apartment, 2 from the island) were being examined by FBI headquarters.
Data carving was being performed on island DVRs to recover deleted files with promising initial results.
Files from 39 items had been exported for review by the Southern District, limited to documents, spreadsheets, emails, and presentations (excluding images and videos).
